text_post: "Hi everyone!I'm starting to look for a new role and would appreciate your support to find the perfect match for me.Since April 2022, I have been living in Tel Aviv and watching how people around me passionately discuss their ideas, develop startups, and invent technologies. Hope to be a part of this vibe!I'm looking for a Head of Product or Senior Product Manager position in products with a focus on data analysis, algorithms, and ML.Thank you in advance for any connections, advice, or opportunities you can offer. #OpenToWork", "I lost my jobSo please don't ignore this postEven if you don't have a job for me, Don't ignore this post...Kindly like, comment, and share so that it reaches your connections and someone may offer me a job#openfornewopportunities #job #support #share #connections #like #comment #jobseeekers #jobseekersupport #lookingforjobs", 'Last October, I made the decision to leave BTS Education after working there for 3 years. I have greatly enjoyed my time at BTS Education and have learned a tremendous amount during my tenure here. I am grateful for the opportunity to have worked with such a talented and dedicated team, and I am proud of the contributions I have made to the company. However, I believe that it is time for me to move on and explore new opportunities that will allow me to continue growing and developing as a professional. Intead of jumping right into job market, I  decided to take a 2-month career break to focus on my professional development. During this time, I read numerous books and took on several professional courses to further my knowledge and skills in product management.I am now excited to re-enter the job market. I am currently seeking new opportunities as a Product Manager with over 12 years of experience in EdTech. In my career, I have had the opportunity to work on a variety of EdTech products, and for the past 4 years, I have been in a management role where I have been responsible for overseeing the development and launch of educational products.I am excited to explore new challenges and opportunities that will allow me to continue to grow and develop as a Product Manager. If you are aware of any open positions or have any leads, I would greatly appreciate any introductions or referrals.Thank you for considering me for your team. I look forward to connecting and discussing potential opportunities further.If possible, please like/comment/repost to increase visibility as well. #OpenToWork #opportunities #connections #productmanagement #tech #edtech #resume #cv #productowner #lookingforjob

text_post: "Some of you know, some of you don't, but I am color blind. More specifically, I have a fairly severe deuteranomaly.Color vision deficiency is a reality for every 200th woman and every 12th man. That is why we founded the Interessenverband der Farbsehschwachen und Farbenblinden (IFFarb) with some colleagues, mostly men because of the genetic aspect.Our main project Farbsehschwaeche is now available in English.There you will find a simulation tool (programmed by Markus Stahmann) to help you understand how people with CVD perceive the world.A few weeks ago we published an article about three simple rules for CVD-inclusive design, which is now also available in English: https://lnkd.in/efYmQTQV#1in200women #1in12men", 'Usability Testing Notion Template (https://lnkd.in/eKfbGnNp), an in-depth template that\xa0includes all steps of testing in one place ‚Äî from recruiting users to reporting results. A neat little helper for keeping track of your testing sessions, collect feedback and analyze it later. Kindly shared by In√™s Duverg√©. #ux #design #research

text_post: "#IkeaNLMotherPuppies #weDoNotCareAboutCustomersWeAreIkeaNL I am wondering - if that is a problem of growth or it's just a disregarding about your clients? The bigger company becomes - more disrespectful and disregarding things to you as to a customer. - Delivery delay? yes, so you have to wait for us, because we have enormous amount of customers, and we are sooory.  - We did not notify you that we sold you items, that not on the stock and you wait for them? So what? yep, we have enormous amount of customers, so you have to pay money and keep your opinion with you. But we are sooory.  - You not happy about our behavior? well, you already payed money and we are veeeery soooory(which means that not we, not anybody else, don't care about how satisfied are you with our service).The bigger company becomes, the more they forget about  customer satisfaction. Ikea hire new developers and managers to manage this hordes of developers, and NON of them can create a super-duper-micro-macro-services which can follow the order, which were not delivered on time and send a simple email, (something like: we are with you, please keep calm). Maybe it is better to start from firing the team, with people, who does not care about main idea behind any business - customer, who pays you money?", "To my network, I'm looking for a new opportunities as Python  and/or Golang developer, in Netherlands(Amsterdam, Utrecht). text_post: ["Remote work is getting a bad rap. Underperforming teams, vanishing culture - this is what I hear constantly.But companies reverting to office life or the hybrid approach need to get this: remote work is a big deal in attracting top talent. Offering just an average salary and some bonus holidays won't cut it. Millennials and Gen-Z professionals are all about freedom and independence; they want more, like the ease of working from home.Still, feeling stubborn? Good luck hooking the best with minor perks!Truth is, the issue isn't remote work itself‚Äîit's how remote teams are being managed.\xa0The lack of know-how is the real culprit.The book 'Remote' nails it with these insights:1. Office drawbacks: Traditional offices can be unproductive due to interruptions and rigid schedules.2. Flexibility of remote work: Remote work offers freedom to choose when and where to work, enhancing productivity.3. Right hires: Remote work requires self-disciplined and independent individuals.4. Trust: Managers should trust remote employees who, in turn, need to be reliable.5. Face-to-face time: Occasional in-person meetings can foster community within remote teams.6. Technology: Use digital tools to enhance remote work effectiveness.To me, commuting to the office feels like a waste of time and resources.You come home drained after an overload of face-to-face interactions and spend countless hours stuck in traffic that could have been quality time with family or pursuing a hobby.The flexibility of remote work also allows you to customize your environment for maximum productivity, free from the one-size-fits-all office setup.#Remotelife\xa0VS\xa0#Officelife", '#farewell #gifts–ü–æ—Å–ª–µ–¥–Ω–∏–µ –ø–æ–¥–∞—Ä–∫–∏ –¥–ª—è —Å–≤–æ–µ–π –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã.–ö–Ω–∏–≥–∏ –∏ —É—Ç–æ—á–∫–∏, –∫–æ—Ç–æ—Ä—ã–µ –æ–±–µ—Å–ø–µ—á–∏–≤–∞—é –Ω–∞—à–µ "—Ç–∞–π–Ω–æ–µ" —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–æ.–ß–µ—Ä–µ–∑ –∫–Ω–∏–≥–∏, —è –ø–æ–ø—ã—Ç–∞–ª—Å—è –æ–±—ä—è—Å–Ω–∏—Ç—å, –∫–∞–∫–∏–µ –∫–æ–º–∞–Ω–¥—ã —è —Å—Ç—Ä–æ–∏–ª (–æ—Å–æ–±–µ–Ω–Ω–æ –æ–±—Ä–∞—Ç–∏—Ç–µ –≤–Ω–∏–º–∞–Ω–∏–µ –Ω–∞ "–ö–æ—Ä–ø–æ—Ä–∞—Ü–∏—è –≥–µ–Ω–∏–µ–≤", –µ—Å–ª–∏ –∏—â–µ—Ç–µ, —á—Ç–æ –ø–æ—á–∏—Ç–∞—Ç—å –ø—Ä–æ —É–ø—Ä–∞–≤–ª–µ–Ω–∏–µ –∏ –º–æ—Ç–∏–≤–∞—Ü–∏—é) –∏–ª–∏ —Å–¥–µ–ª–∞–ª –¥–æ–ø–æ–ª–Ω–∏—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω—ã–µ —à–∞–≥–∏ –≤ –æ–±—Ä–∞–∑–æ–≤–∞—Ç–µ–ª—å–Ω–æ–º –ø—É—Ç–∏ —Å–æ—Ç—Ä—É–¥–Ω–∏–∫–æ–≤ ("–Ø—Å–Ω–æ, –ø–æ–Ω—è—Ç–Ω–æ" –∏–ª–∏ –∫–Ω–∏–≥–∏ –ø—Ä–æ –∞–ª–≥–æ—Ä–∏—Ç–º—ã).–£—Ç–æ—á–∫–∏ - —ç—Ç–æ –Ω–∞—à —Ç–∞–π–Ω—ã–π —Å–∏–º–≤–æ–ª —Å–æ–æ–±—â–µ—Å—Ç–≤–∞, –µ—Å–ª–∏ —É –í–∞—Å —É—Ç–æ—á–∫–∞ —Å –Ω–∞—à–∏–º "—Ç–∞–π–Ω—ã–º –∑–Ω–∞–∫–æ–º", —Ç–æ –≤—ã –Ω–µ –æ—Å—Ç–∞–Ω–µ—Ç–µ—Å—å\xa0–≤ –±–µ–¥–µ (–∏—â–∏—Ç–µ —É—Ç–æ—á–µ–∫ —É —Å–≤–æ–∏—Ö –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–≥ üòâ)–°–ø–∞—Å–∏–±–æ –í–∞–º, –º–æ–∏ –ù–ê–°–¢–û–Ø–©–ò–ï –∫–æ–ª–ª–µ–≥–∏!

text_post: "I have created a video that can be useful for digital marketers with a mobile focus. Google UAC campaigns provide high-quality traffic having huge lead capacity.Hi. It is my first marketing post and I will try to make the one compelling.Looking to boost your app's visibility on Google Ads? Look no further! In this video, we'll show you how to run a killer Universal App Campaign (UAC) with a focus on installs. This is the ultimate guide to getting your app seen by the right people at the right time. Here's what's in store:00:00 Introduction https://lnkd.in/dYbWWpV9: Get to know the host of the video and why they're the right person to guide you through UACs.00:44 What are Universal App Campaigns (UAC) https://lnkd.in/dtzM-P3X? Learn what UACs are all about and how they can help you promote your app.01:49 Where can you run UAC campaigns https://lnkd.in/dSJciuka?Discover the different places where your UAC can appear, including Google Search, YouTube, Google Play, and other apps on the Display Network for both Android and iOS.02:07 Location setup on GUAC campaigns https://lnkd.in/dG8Jrv7z:Make sure your campaign is hitting the right locations to get maximum impact.05:16 Set up languages https://lnkd.in/dJtZCRcv: Choose the language options that will resonate best with your target audience.06:46 set up dates https://lnkd.in/dJHPTb2g06:59 Data feed: 07:34 Budget and bidding https://lnkd.in/deSbAwNc: Decide on the budget and bidding that's right for your campaign, including focuses like install volume, in-app action, and in-app action values.12:45 Brief asset setup overview https://lnkd.in/dUGNJPTM14:39 Summary https://lnkd.in/dcJDz3_R: A quick rundown of what you learned in the video.14:59 Next videos https://lnkd.in/de6FP7GE: Check out more videos on app advertising and promotion.By the end of this video, you'll be a UAC pro, ready to get your app in front of the right people and make a real impact on Google Ads. So, what are you waiting for? Let's get started!I am open to collaboration in the digital marketing space. The presentation link https://lnkd.in/dMYx8jWiThe video link https://lnkd.in/dsfhgc76Thank you, Ankur Chugh, Thomas Petit and Kirill Getmanskiy for the help with the video.#marketing #google #advertising #android #openforbusiness #openfornewopportunities #openforwork #googleads #googleadwords #googleadsexpert #googlemarketing #uac #mobilemarketing #mobileadvertising #googleadswords #googleadswords #googleadscampaign #googleadsspecialist", '–ö–ª–∞—Å—Å–Ω–∞—è –ø–æ–¥–±–æ—Ä–∫–∞ –æ—Ç Denis Ralko–ü–æ —Å–æ–±—Å—Ç–≤–µ–Ω–Ω–æ–º—É –æ–ø—ã—Ç—É –∑–Ω–∞—é, –∞–Ω–≥–ª–∏–π—Å–∫–∏–π –æ—á–µ–Ω—å –Ω—É–∂–µ–Ω)#Job #Junior #Vacancy #English #HR

name: Leo Ostrovskiy

text_post: 'Hello all!I`m Frontend Developer with 3 years of commercial experience and I`m looking for new career opportunities in Europe.Few words about me:I`m currently working as a Frontend developer.My current technology stack is: React, NextJS, NodeJS.During my developing career, I had been working on lots of projects with different specifics, such as Fin-tech, entertainment , web-markets, metaverse worlds, NFTs. I would be glad to show you all of these projects in production). All projects are sticked to accessibility and semantics to correspond to European standards.I believe that to create stable, maintainable and user-friendly software, developers should get pleasure and be involved in work. So my purpose is to create projects that are firstly aimed to increase Developer Experience. I believe that there should be no doubt when you do something.I never passed deadlines, all tasks are done in time.I`m a good team player. I like to communicate with team, plan daily team meetings, discuss tasks and project perspectives.So, here is my CV. Looking forward to hear from you!
name: Leo Ostrovskiy

text_post: "Hi dear US-based colleagues, friends and network!My former employee Roman G. (who actually ended up becoming a friend), has been laid off from his position of Data Engineer in a US-based company and is looking for a new challenge.\xa0I can recommend him for his diligence, ambition, attitude to work that has been outstanding though the year we've worked together. He is looking for a challenge in Data / Analytics Engineering in a company with strong corporate and data culture, and an established data and engineering teams. I have no doubt he would be a great addition of skills and expertise to any team.
